ADJUSTING.Definition: to change something slightly, especially to make it more correct, effective, or suitable

ANCESTRY.Definition: your ancestors who lived a long time ago, or the origin of your family

ALLEGATIONS.Definition: statements, made without giving proof, that someone has done something wrong or illegal

BENEFICIARIES.Definition: a person or group who receives money, advantages, etc. as a result of something else

BIDDER.Definition: someone who offers to pay a particular amount of money for something

BIDDING.Definition: the act of offering to pay a particular amount of money for something, by different people

BIRTHRIGHT.Definition: something that you believe you deserve to have because of your family situation or social class, or because you believe it is your right as a human being

BOOM.Definition: a period of sudden economic growth, especially one that results in a lot of money being made

CITIZENSHIP.Definition: the state of being a member of a particular country and having rights because of it

COLONIAL.Definition: relating to a colony or colonialism

CRITIC.Definition: someone who says that they do not approve of someone or something

DESCENT.Definition: the state or fact of being related to a particular person or group of people who lived in the past

DESERVING.Definition: If people or things are deserving, they should be helped because they have good qualities

EMBASSY.Definition: the official building of a country (in another country)

ERODE.Definition: to rub or be rubbed away gradually

FORK OUT.Definition: to pay an amount of money, especially unwillingly

FORMATIVE.Definition: relating to the time when someone or something is starting to develop in character

GOLD MINE.Definition: something that produces wealth or information

GOLD RUSH.Definition: a situation in which a lot of people move to a place to try to find gold because they have heard that gold has been found there

GRANT.Definition: to give or allow someone something, usually in an official way

IMPLICATIONS.Definition: an occasion when you seem to suggest something without saying it directly

IN NAME ONLY.Definition: If a situation exists in name only, it is officially described that way, although that description is not completely accurate

INCENTIVES.Definition: things that encourages a person to do something

INFLATION.Definition: a general, continuous increase in prices

INSURANCE POLICY.Definition: a written agreement for insurance between an insurance company and a person who wants insurance

INTERACTION.Definition: an occasion when two or more people or things communicate with or react to each other

LUCRATIVE.Definition: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money

MASTERMIND.Definition: to plan a difficult activity, often a crime, in detail and make certain that it happens successfully

MEANS.Definition: a method or way of doing something

MIDDLEMEN.Definition: a person who buys goods from the company that has produced them and makes a profit by selling them to a shop or a user

MURKY.Definition: dark and dirty or difficult to see through

NATIONALITY.Definition: the official right to belong to a particular country

NATIONHOOD.Definition: the fact of being a nation (= a country with its own government, language, traditions, etc.)

NICKNAMED.Definition: given an informal name for someone or something, especially a name that you are called by your friends or family, usually based on your real name or your character

OLIGARCHS.Definition: very rich and powerful people (in an oligarchy)

PHENOMENON.Definition: something that exists and can be seen, felt, tasted, etc., especially something unusual or interesting

PLETHORA.Definition: a very large amount of something, especially a larger amount than you need, want, or can deal with

SCHENGEN.Definition: an agreement between many countries of the European Union that allows people and goods to pass freely across the borders of each country without passport or other controls.

SEIZED.Definition: to take something quickly and keep or hold it

SHORTAGE.Definition: a situation in which there is not enough of something

SHOVELS.Definition: a tool consisting of a wide, square metal or plastic blade, usually with slightly raised sides, attached to a handle, for moving loose material such as sand, coal, or snow

SOVEREIGNTY.Definition: the power of a country to control its own government

STATE THE OBVIOUS.Definition: to say something that everyone knows

STATELESS.Definition: A stateless person has no country that they officially belong to

STATUS SYMBOL.Definition: a thing that people want to have because they think other people will admire them if they have it

STRUGGLE.Definition: to experience difficulty and make a very great effort in order to do something

SUPERFICIAL.Definition: not complete and involving only the most obvious things

SURPLUS.Definition: (an amount that is) more than is needed

UNACCUSTOMED.Definition: not familiar with something, or not used to something

UNSCRUPULOUS.Definition: behaving in a way that is dishonest or unfair in order to get what you want

UP YOUR GAME.Definition: to try harder and improve the quality of what you are doing

WHATSOEVER.Definition: used after a negative phrase to add emphasis to the idea that is being expressed

WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people

WILL.Definition: the mental power used to control and direct your thoughts and actions, or a determination to do something, despite any difficulties or opposition
